items.text: back of a length on off stump, leans back and chops it to backward point
items.shortText: Cottrell to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.text: half-volley on off stump, Nurse dives right at short cover to stop Mushfiqur's drive
items.shortText: Cottrell to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.text: back of a length on middle stump, stays leg-side of the ball and hops to ride the bounce, defends down towards backward point
items.shortText: Cottrell to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.text: short, gets up to chest height on leg stump, Mushfiqur pulls it round to long leg
shortish, tucked off the hip to the left of long leg

items.preText: Morvin Williams: "With no salutes from Cottrell in recent times, these men in the barracks must be well disgruntled. Hope there is no uprising!"
items.text: back of a length, middle and leg line, clipped to midwicket

items.preText: Thirty to get now, and Roach returns. Over the wicket.
items.text: back of a length on off stump, lets it come on and defends to backward point with an open face
items.shortText: Roach to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.text: down the track, makes himself a bit of room, and Roach follows him by darting one at his feet. Clipped to midwicket
items.shortText: Roach to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.text: shortish, angling in towards middle stump. Looks to pull and bottom-edges into his body
items.shortText: Roach to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.text: short outside off, pulled to the right of deep square leg
slower yorker on leg stump, clipped to deep square leg
shortish on off stump, blocked back to the bowler

items.preText:
James: "The 1970's and 80's WI teams lead the world in fielding (Wasim Akram was joking to Michael Holding that his wickets should count double Michael's because Pakistan dropped so many catches!). Shame some of the current side are so poor at it. Pollard would definitely improve that aspect."

Andy: "I totally agree with you Chris. Pollard's recent form warrants selection. Also, he is quietly showing that he saves his best performances for the big occasion. Check his scores in IPL finals. Pollard is a shoo-in for me!"
items.text: in the blockhole on off stump, jabbed towards mid-off. Rolls slowly to the fielder and that gives them the time to hurry through for one
back of a length, fourth-stump line, punched crisply to the right of deep point
slower ball, full on leg stump, clipped to long-on
length ball angling away from off stump, presses forward and punches towards backward point
full, close to off stump, shows the full face to punch to mid-off
loopy slower ball angling away into a sixth-stump line. Looks to open his bat face and steer it down to third man, sends it rolling to the keeper off the toe end
yorker on middle stump, jabbed back to the bowler
items.shortText: Roach to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.preText: Stats Black: "Fabian Allen has bowled 29 overs in ODI cricket without a wicket. His List A figures aint appealing either. what is he doing in WI squad? Can someone tell me?"
items.text: slower short ball, sits up on off stump, pulled to the left of deep square leg to bring up a brilliantly paced fifty

and he celebrates with a glorious piece of timing. Looks for the yorker again, on off stump, but it ends up as a low full-toss, and Mushfiqur just meets it with a straight bat and sends it racing away to the boundary to the right of deep point
items.shortText: Roach to Mushfiqur Rahim, FOUR runs

items.text: short, gets up near the right shoulder. An awkward place to pull from, and he ends up ballooning it in the air, over midwicket and to his left
slower ball, full and wide, and Mushfiqur gets on the front foot and thumps it over cover
items.shortText: Roach to Mushfiqur Rahim, FOUR runs

items.text: short, angling into off stump, pulled to deep square leg
fullish on off stump, driven to deep point
